byline.contributor: Nate Schweber reported from Friendship, and Rick Rojas from New York. Reporting was contributed by Susanne Craig and Michael D. Regan from Friendship, Benjamin Mueller from New York and Jesse McKinley from Albany.
byline.original: By NATE SCHWEBER and RICK ROJAS

abstract: Reported sighting of prison escapees Richard W Matt and David P Sweat near Friendship, NY, is considered credible, leading to intense search in community more than 300 miles south of Clinton Correctional Facility; many residents take increased precautions, locking doors and readying firearms.
lead_paragraph: Residents near Friendship, N.Y., talked about a weekend of locking doors, curtailing Father’s Day plans and readying guns as they braced for the two inmates to surface.

headline.main: Possible Sighting of Escaped Killers Jolts Town
headline.print_headline: Tips Pour in as Possible Sighting of Killers Jolts Town

snippet: Residents near Friendship, N.Y., talked about a weekend of locking doors, curtailing Father’s Day plans and readying guns as they braced for the two inmates to surface.
